member.name: T:Stride.Core.IO.UPath
member.summary: Base class that describes a uniform path and provides method to manipulate them. Concrete class are and . This class is immutable and its descendants are immutable. See remarks.
member.remarks:
A uniform path contains only characters '/' to separate directories and doesn't contain any successive '/' or './'. This class is used to represent a path, relative or absolute to a directory or filename.
This class can be used to represent uniforms paths both on windows or unix platforms TODO Provide more documentation on how to use this class

member.name: T:Stride.Core.Transactions.ITransactionStack
member.summary: An interface representing a transaction stack.
member.remarks: A transaction stack is a stack with a predefined . Transactions that are completed are added to the top of the stack. When the stack is full, any new transaction that is added will discard the transaction at the bottom of the stack (which is the oldest transaction still in the stack) in order to create a slot to add itself on the top. Transaction can be rollbacked to restore previous states, and also rollforwarded again. Rollbacked transactions remain on the stack, but if a new transaction is added, they will be discarded (purged) from the stack and the new transaction will be added on the top of last non-rollbacked transaction. Any transaction that is discarded will be frozen, a mechanism that allows to release references to related object and allow garbage collecting them. Freezing is similar to disposing but is a different interface since the interface is used to complete transactions in order to make then compatible with the using statement.

member.summary: Gets the capacity of the transaction stack.

member.summary: Gets whether the transaction stack is currently empty.

member.summary: Releases the file lock.

members.member:
Tries to take ownership of the file lock without waiting.
Tries to take ownership of the file lock within a given delay. A new instance of if the ownership could be taken, null otherwise. The returned must be disposed to release the mutex.

Waits indefinitely to take ownership of the file lock.
Tries to take ownership of the file lock within a given delay. A new instance of if the ownership could be taken, null otherwise. The returned must be disposed to release the file lock.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.Windows.FileLock.Wait(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to take ownership of the file lock within a given delay.
member.param: A unique name identifying the file lock.
The maximum delay to wait before returning, in milliseconds.
member.returns: A new instance of if the ownership could be taken, null otherwise.
member.remarks: The returned must be disposed to release the file lock. Calling this method with 0 for is equivalent to call . Calling this method with a negative value for is equivalent to call .
